summary: Why I think Jon and Dany will live in the books
body:
Why I think Jon and Dany will live in the books

First off, let me go ahead and say that I don’t believe for a second that the books will end like the show. Not one bit.

Why? Why don’t I believe this? Am I in denial? George said so, after all. Right?

No.

George said that he doesn’t THINK it will be different. We’ve known for years now that George gave dumb and dumber an outline for them to follow. And we know that he said that they’d end up at the same point but take different roads. That was back in 2014/15 when GoT had just passed the source material. And at the time, George had no reason to suspect that they’d absolutely fuck his life’s work. I mean, George himself acknowledged that the show had made same changes that he wished he would have done. One of the main ones being Arya meeting Tywin at Harrenhal. Practically everyone agrees that it’s one of the best changes. So, at the time, George had no reason to worry. And then S7 came out. And it was clear that George was distancing himself as much as humanly possibly from the shitshow he foresaw coming. iirc, D&D didn’t even give him a script to read for what was to come for S8 like they did previous seasons.

But Brandon! What about his interview with 60 minutes? Where George said he didn’t think it’d be that different?

To that I say, “watch it again”. Look at the reluctance on that man’s face as he answers it. There is goddamn pain there, hidden far better than Emilia Clarke’s displeasure at S8 but still readable. Why is there pain? Because he knows that the ending is SO much different. Because what happened in the show does not line up with his ending in the books. Dorne? Fucked in the show? FAegon? His story is split between Cersei and Jon(who does jack shit in S8). White Walkers? The NK was created for a convenient one hit self destruct button.

Moreover, George didn’t talk about S8 once. He never tweeted after an episode. He didn’t write about it on his blog, instead rather more interested in the NFL draft. The only time he talked about S8 was after the finale and even then it was simply to tell us he was working on Winds of Winter. He didn’t talk about how brilliant he found the season. Just that the ride was over. Yup.

Finally, it’s also very clear that D&D went their own way. Lena Headey’s confirmation about filming a miscarriage was the final nail in the coffin that confirmed to me that S8 was no way in hell a direction that Martin was intending. David and Dan’s own words confirm this. Saying that they wanted Arya to kill the NK because it was unexpected! This was a decision they came to in 2016. Years after Martin was done advising them. It became very clear to me that David and Dan abused their exclusive TV rights to the show and told the story how THEY wanted it to end.

Now, onto why I think Jon and Dany will live.

I believe I should first make it known that I do think Dany will die. Yup, I said it. I think she will die, and I think she will be resurrected. Why? Because Dany has been claimed to have been “reborn” after emerging from the flames unscathed. Reborn, which implicated that she died and was born again. But she didn’t die. Not at all. Martin has confirmed that it was a once in a lifetime miracle of blood magic involved. However, I don’t believe he’s using her description of rebirth just for smokes and mirrors. He is, correctly, using foreshadowing.

Dany will die and then be reborn via a red priestess. And why not? She has the entire fucking temple set to back her in the books, like in the show. And you’re telling me that somebody isn’t going to suggest having them revive her? One of her followers, possibly Jon, won’t go to a red priestess and beg for something to be done? And you know what? I think she WAS meant to be reborn. And that’s what pisses me off. Because I believe D&D decided not to and then just teased us with it for a final slap in the face. Sam mentions that Drogon was seen in Volantis and one of the songs for season 8, “Pray”, mentions that ‘We can bring her back, we can bring her back’.

So, I think she will die and be resurrected, further bringing Jon and Daenerys closer to one another and paralleling their roads as similar once again.

And after her resurrection, she’ll find Jon living in a house with a red door and a lemon tree. A house that she told him about when she was previously alive. And for the final cherry on top? It’s in Dorne. Why in Dorne? Because Martin has hinted to us that Braavos does not grow lemon trees and does not hold the climate that Daenerys remembers so fondly. And Dorne also holds significance to Jon. It is the place of his birth and more significant, somewhere warm.

During season 6, the last season that D&D followed the story logically with some little semblance, Jon tells Edd that he will look for some place to get warm. Yet, he never does. Not once does he ever go to a warm climate area. The closest he ever comes to warmth are Dragonstone, which is already described as being cold during the winter without experiencing snow, and King’s Landing. And the only time he ever experienced the two are during…*drum roll*…winter… the coldest season. Something else that I’m sure D&D changed from the ending. You mean to tell me that Jon Snow has no intention of visiting where it all started? Where he was born? Where his mother died? Fuck off.

And lastly, they will have a child. Something else that D&D ignored, I believe. Why? Because we already have evidence of them changing shit for their desires. I believe Jon WAS meant to go further south and end up in Dorne(the warmest place in Westeros). They teased in S6 and ignored it when it didn’t suit their story. Something else that didn’t suit their story? A baby.

At the end of S6, book readers were left wondering what the hell happened to Daenerys’ fertility, seeing as she suffers a miscarriage at the end of ADWD. Then we said, “oh, better to leave it here for impact for boatbaby I guess” when they finally fucking talked about it in S7. Except, no! She is barren after all! No suggestions that she ever got pregnant in S8. Screw you D&D. George gave it clear to us that she can get pregnant once more.

So there. I think the Walker threat will be resolved (and no, I don’t believe that shitty theory that Jon has to come to an agreement with the WW and live as an ambassador for the living. That’s as worse as the “Bran is dreaming it all” Theory), Dany will die and be resurrected and Jon and Dany will live together in Dorne in a House with a Red Door that has a lemon tree. And that they will live out their days with their children and grandchildren, away from all the politics and leadership they were forced into.

title: Be My Date
body:
Written for day 5 of @jonsadreamofspring based on the prompt “AU day: Modern”

Sansa is at a party when she meets Joffrey Baratheon, finally her now ex-boyfriend, again. One problem. She told him she had a new boyfriend. Bigger problem. That boyfriend doesn’t exist. Yet.

Modern AU // Fake Dating AU

“O no…” Sansa shook her head in absolute disbelief when she saw Joffrey Baratheon enter the club with an air of confidence surrounding him. “This can’t be happening.” She downed her still half full glass of wine and quickly she reached for another one. She needed more alcohol. And she desperately needed that boyfriend she had been bragging about every time Joffrey had texted her to ask if there was really no way he could make it up to her.

The only problem was that that boyfriend she had been bragging about didn’t really exist.

As soon as he saw her Joffrey’s eyes widened and Sansa felt pearls of sweat covering her forehead.

She had to do something and she had to do something now. “Hey…” She curled her fingers around the wrist of the boy standing next to her. “Can you pretend to be my boyfriend, please?” She kept one eye on the unknown boy and one eye on her ex who was now walking across the dance floor, each step carrying him closer and closer towards her. “I’ll pay your drinks for the rest of the evening.” She didn’t give him the chance to say no.

“Sansa!”

She grabbed the stranger’s hand and entwined their fingers. “Joffrey!” She forced herself to smile at him. “I haven’t seen you in a while. What are you doing here?”

“I can’t miss Margaery Tyrell’s birthday party, can I?” Joffrey placed his hands on her shoulders and his wet lips pecked her cheeks.

The urge to throw up was almost overwhelming, but she was not gonna show him that he still had that kind of power over her, that he still had some kind of power over her, that he still had any kind of power over her.

“And I actually hoped to finally see you again too.” Joffrey stepped back and he furrowed his eyebrows when he looked at the stranger next to Sansa. “I guess this is the boyfriend you’ve dumped me for?” His eyes shamelessly wandered over the young man’s body and Sansa followed his glance.

The stranger was actually quite handsome. His long black curls were tied into a bun and his broad shoulders implied that he was part of some sports team. And even though he wasn’t very tall, he still looked slightly intimidating with his straight back and his lifted chin.

This could have been much worse, to be honest.

“Yes!” Sansa’s voice sounded a little higher than usually, but she hoped Joffrey wouldn’t notice that. “But we only met after I’ve already dumped you.” She cocked her head slightly and she let her head rest on the young man’s shoulders. “So, this is Joffrey, my ex-boyfriend.” She emphasized the ex. “And this is…”

“Jon Snow.” The stranger interrupted her before this entire situation could get humiliating and embarrassing. “Quarterback, but since it’s winter I’m now kickboxing to stay in shape.” His voice was warm and encouragingly he squeezed her hand.

Reluctantly Joffrey stepped back and he scratched the back of his neck. “O, a quarterback.” He grinned, but the grin missed its usual arrogance. “Wow, I never thought you had that in you.” He turned his face towards Sansa again and Sansa felt her cheeks heating up.

“Well…” She shrugged. “Still waters run deep, I guess.” She shifted her weight from one leg to the other and she took another sip from her wine. “Jon and I met at a party and he thought I was…”

“Beautiful and brave and intelligent.” Jon smiled and Sansa stared at him for a short moment. “I still can’t believe that a woman like her really fell in love with a guy like me.” He pulled her a little closer towards him and his lips kissed her hair. “I’m absolutely lucky that things between you two didn’t work out. So, I guess I have to thank you?”

Joffrey furrowed his eyebrows and for the first time ever Sansa saw him speechless. It only lasted a few seconds and then he managed to get himself together again. “There are prettier fishes in the sea.” He shrugged and turned around and a few seconds later he disappeared in the crowd.

Sansa finally allowed herself to let out a deep breath. “Thank you so much.” She pulled her hand away and tucked a strand of red hair behind her ear. “You have no idea how much this meant to me.” She shifted her weight again. “So, what can I get you? I was serious. The rest of the evening all drinks are on me.”

“You’re welcome.” He reached for her hand again and strangely enough his touch felt comforting and pleasant. “I guess things between you and that Joffrey guy didn’t really end well?”

Sansa bent her head and stared at her feet. “It’s my own fault. I really thought he loved me, but…” She swallowed. “I don’t think he even knows what love is. He just wanted to posses me. I was so stupid and everything I remember that I almost…” She hesitated and thought about how close she had been to giving him her body.

“If he’s the one who hurt you, then none of this was your fault, Sansa.” Jon let her hand go again. “You couldn’t have known that he was a dick.” He was the first one to ever say that to her.

“You really think so?” She looked up at him and she noticed the frown on his forehead and a certain sadness in his wonderful brown eyes.

He nodded. “If someone hurts you it’s their fault and only theirs.”

She wondered how often he had told himself that story. She wondered who had hurt him and how long and often he had blamed himself for that. “So, do you prefer a beer? A Bacardi-Coke? Something else?”

Jon’s lips curled up into a slight smile. “If you don’t mind, I’d like something else.” He cocked his head and his lips trembled slightly. “What about you don’t getting me that drink now, but taking me out for lunch tomorrow?”

For a moment Sansa just stared at him and then she shook her head. “Is this you asking me on a date?” She widened her eyes and dropped her jaw.

“If you’re not ready for it, I get that, but…” He licked his lips. “You seem like a girl worth getting to know better, so…”

A smile spread across Sansa’s face and her heart skipped a beat in her chest. “Lunch tomorrow sounds perfect.”

Jon smiled back. “I’ll meet you at one at the Smoking Log then.”
body_abstract:
Written for day 5 of @jonsadreamofspring based on the prompt “AU day: Modern”

Sansa is at a party when she meets Joffrey Baratheon, finally her now ex-boyfriend, again. One problem. She told him she had a new boyfriend. Bigger problem. That boyfriend doesn’t exist. Yet.

Modern AU // Fake Dating AU

“O no…” Sansa shook her head in absolute disbelief when she saw Joffrey Baratheon enter the club with an air of confidence surrounding him. “This can’t be happening.” She downed her still half full glass of wine and quickly she reached for another one. She needed more alcohol. And she desperately needed that boyfriend she had been bragging about every time Joffrey had texted her to ask if there was really no way he could make it up to her.

The only problem was that that boyfriend she had been bragging about didn’t really exist.

As soon as he saw her Joffrey’s eyes widened and Sansa felt pearls of sweat covering her forehead.

She had to do something and she had to do something now. “Hey…” She curled her fingers around the wrist of the boy standing next to her. “Can you pretend to be my boyfriend, please?” She kept one eye on the unknown boy and one eye on her ex who was now walking across the dance floor, each step carrying him closer and closer towards her. “I’ll pay your drinks for the rest of the evening.” She didn’t give him the chance to say no.

“Sansa!”

She grabbed the stranger’s hand and entwined their fingers. “Joffrey!” She forced herself to smile at him. “I haven’t seen you in a while. What are you doing here?”

“I can’t miss Margaery Tyrell’s birthday party, can I?” Joffrey placed his hands on her shoulders and his wet lips pecked her cheeks.

The urge to throw up was almost overwhelming, but she was not gonna show him that he still had that kind of power over her, that he still had some kind of power over her, that he still had any kind of power over her.

blog.name: valyrhos
blog.title: Piecing Together Character Arcs
blog.description:
Hi, I'm Rheia, I love spending my life overanalysing fantasy novels. Welcome to my descent into madness.
We Stan Daenerys in this household.

title: Direwolf Symbolism (ASoIaF)
body:
The direwolves of ASoIaF were the first things ever to exist in the series, the scene of the Starks finding them was the first thing GRRM ever thought of that eventually led to the books we know and love, plus the TV show we watched. Every single direwolf tells you so much about its corresponding kid, packed with a whole bunch of symbolism. 

For starters, every direwolf mirrors the personality of the kid- Grey Wind was fierce in battle, stern, and intelligent like Robb. Lady, for the short time that we knew her, was quiet and gentle like early Sansa. Summer is Bran in most aspects, as he gains Bran’s intelligence whenever he is warged. Summer notably tries to climb a tree, despite being a wolf, because he is Bran’s. Nymeria is just like Arya too, being adventurous, and violent. Very violent, Arya and Nymeria have a sort of positive feedback loop in their violence, for the Night Wolf, their combined personality, is a mankiller leading hundreds of wolves, killing Lannisters like a champion. That too is similar to Rickon and Shaggydog, Rickon is repeatedly described as being ‘wild’, and Shaggydog repeatedly savages and bites humans. Ghost is silent like broody Jon, but seems to be a good deal smarter than his human. It’s helpful to remember that, in the books, every single Stark kid is a warg. Robb and Grey Wind fight ‘like one’, Sansa unfortunately never gets the opportunity to warg Lady, Bran is the most obvious example, Arya wargs Nymeria every night, as well as stray Braavosi cats, and we never see Rickon’s perspective, but he too is very close to his wolf. Jon wargs Ghost in his sleep, and Varamyr Sixskins confirms that he is a powerful warg.

All of that is mostly surface-level, however. It’s pretty obvious that the Starks warg their wolves and have similar personalities, but what I like about the wolves is how they represent life and Stark identity. Also, the placement of the direwolves when they are first found is important. If you were to compare it to a family tree, you have the mother direwolf, lying dead on the ground, the five underneath her, and then Ghost, a white direwolf (white like Targaryen hair?) is off to the side, like a cousin would be. Jon is a cousin to the Stark kids.

The deaths of the direwolves hold meaning too. Sansa is a Stark, but she is the least Stark of all the kids. Sansa looks like a Tully, is south for the entire story, and her direwolf dies very early on. The death of Lady can be interpreted as the death of Sansa’s Stark identity or status, distancing her from the other children. Similairly, Arya sends away Nymeria, she sends away a crucial part of her person, which ties into her themes of the loss of identity, while putting the notion that, it is not dead, only sent away. Arya is never truly able to give up being Arya Stark, because Nymeria is not dead and gone, only away temporarily. Arya loses her identity but she will likely regain it in the next two books. Robb never loses his Stark status in this way, instead he dies with his wolf, he dies a Stark. RIckon is currently absent in the books, but it is likely he will die in that same way, with his wolf, Rickon will likely die a Stark. Summer is not yet dead, but it is likely that, in the effort to truly become the three-eyed crow, he will die like in the show, and Bran will cease to be a Stark, and start being a crow. 

I find that Nymeria is the most interesting of all the wolves, as she can kind of be seen as a split piece of Arya. When Arya is the Night Wolf, that is the only time she feels whole, when with Nymeria. She fishes the dead body of her mother out of a river, she has a real pack, she has power when she is Nymeria. Arya is repeatedly described to have a ‘hole where her heart used to be’, a missing piece of her soul and identity, which is Nymeria. Arya will never be whole until she is back with Nymeria, back with her Stark identity, back with her family. 

Ghost is the other wolf we know the most about, and mostly I interpret wolf as a bit of a clue to Jon’s Targaryen identity, as he is white like the silver hair of the Targs. Ghost is also a very smart direwolf, smarter than Jon I would say, and he is able to scout, find the dead wights in the forest, and generally be the best boy in the universe who deserves pets.

reblog.comment:
The direwolves of ASoIaF were the first things ever to exist in the series, the scene of the Starks finding them was the first thing GRRM ever thought of that eventually led to the books we know and love, plus the TV show we watched. Every single direwolf tells you so much about its corresponding kid, packed with a whole bunch of symbolism. 

For starters, every direwolf mirrors the personality of the kid- Grey Wind was fierce in battle, stern, and intelligent like Robb. Lady, for the short time that we knew her, was quiet and gentle like early Sansa. Summer is Bran in most aspects, as he gains Bran’s intelligence whenever he is warged. Summer notably tries to climb a tree, despite being a wolf, because he is Bran’s. Nymeria is just like Arya too, being adventurous, and violent. Very violent, Arya and Nymeria have a sort of positive feedback loop in their violence, for the Night Wolf, their combined personality, is a mankiller leading hundreds of wolves, killing Lannisters like a champion. That too is similar to Rickon and Shaggydog, Rickon is repeatedly described as being ‘wild’, and Shaggydog repeatedly savages and bites humans. Ghost is silent like broody Jon, but seems to be a good deal smarter than his human. It’s helpful to remember that, in the books, every single Stark kid is a warg. Robb and Grey Wind fight ‘like one’, Sansa unfortunately never gets the opportunity to warg Lady, Bran is the most obvious example, Arya wargs Nymeria every night, as well as stray Braavosi cats, and we never see Rickon’s perspective, but he too is very close to his wolf. Jon wargs Ghost in his sleep, and Varamyr Sixskins confirms that he is a powerful warg.

All of that is mostly surface-level, however. It’s pretty obvious that the Starks warg their wolves and have similar personalities, but what I like about the wolves is how they represent life and Stark identity. Also, the placement of the direwolves when they are first found is important. If you were to compare it to a family tree, you have the mother direwolf, lying dead on the ground, the five underneath her, and then Ghost, a white direwolf (white like Targaryen hair?) is off to the side, like a cousin would be. Jon is a cousin to the Stark kids.

The deaths of the direwolves hold meaning too. Sansa is a Stark, but she is the least Stark of all the kids. Sansa looks like a Tully, is south for the entire story, and her direwolf dies very early on. The death of Lady can be interpreted as the death of Sansa’s Stark identity or status, distancing her from the other children. Similairly, Arya sends away Nymeria, she sends away a crucial part of her person, which ties into her themes of the loss of identity, while putting the notion that, it is not dead, only sent away. Arya is never truly able to give up being Arya Stark, because Nymeria is not dead and gone, only away temporarily. Arya loses her identity but she will likely regain it in the next two books. Robb never loses his Stark status in this way, instead he dies with his wolf, he dies a Stark. RIckon is currently absent in the books, but it is likely he will die in that same way, with his wolf, Rickon will likely die a Stark. Summer is not yet dead, but it is likely that, in the effort to truly become the three-eyed crow, he will die like in the show, and Bran will cease to be a Stark, and start being a crow.

Ghost is also a very smart direwolf, smarter than Jon I would say, and he is able to scout, find the dead wights in the forest, and generally be the best boy in the universe who deserves pets.

summary: “Everything that’s come out of your mouth has been lies” with Jon Snow
title: “Everything that’s come out of your mouth has been lies” with Jon Snow
body:
Note: This is incest since the reader is Deanery’s sister so aunt/nephew incest ):

Jon Snow is your lover and Daenerys Targaryen is your sister. Once again, Daenerys Targaryen is your sister and Jon Snow is your nephew. You weren’t sure how long the secret would come out but you didn’t expect it now.

“I’m sorry”, you told him tears forming, “You lied to me”, Jon is furious from his clenched teeth to clenched fists.  “You’re my aunt”, Jon stated not as a question but as a fact, “I’m so sorry”, you looked down as tears now are forming. “Bran told me-” you were cut off by Jon, “Because you need an alliance”. “No”, you refused to shake your head.

“I hide it because I love you”, you start to sob reaching out for Jon only to be rejected by him.

“Everything that’s come out of your mouth has been lies”, Jon said with clear distrust and loathing. You went to try to reach out once more only to be rejected once more as he’ll leave the room. “Jon!” You scream for him but he doesn’t bother to look back or stop. “Jon!” You kept screaming his name as he finally left as he left you all alone. A Targaryen alone is a terrible thing.

summary: I would need to steal her if I wanted her love, but she might give me children. I might someday hold a son of my own blood in my...
caption:
I would need to steal her if I wanted her love, but she might give me children. I might someday hold a son of my own blood in my arms. A son was something Jon Snow had never dared dream of, since he decided to live his life on the Wall. I could name him Robb. Val would want to keep her sister’s son, but we could foster him at Winterfell, and Gilly’s boy as well. Sam would never need to tell his lie. We’d find a place for Gilly too, and Sam could come visit her once a year or so. Mance’s son and Craster’s would grow up brothers, as I once did with Robb. 

For @starryweasley‘s Jon x Robb Sims & little family.

summary: 🍺 do u think Robb would’ve been a good king for everyone? Better than Jon (if he didn’t go north at the end)?
question: 🍺 do u think Robb would’ve been a good king for everyone? Better than Jon (if he didn’t go north at the end)?
answer:
Le Big OOF

  • I love all my Stark Boys Equally 😭

So like maybe? Neither of these boys want the Iron Throne and I feel bad forcing it on them lol.

Robb wasn’t really trying to be king of anything so that could’ve worked in his favor in how he might rule everyone equally, but I think he’s more of a stickler for tradition (as far as ruling goes) whereas Jon cares less about precedent and more about what is right/helpful. I don’t know if it would’ve been better than Jon (who’s entire character is based around ‘honorably serving the realms of men’) and all rulers should first and foremost serve their people.

Had Jon ended up on the Iron Throne, I believe the world could’ve been a better place OR he could’ve been completely manipulated out of his desire to do what is right whereas had Robb although he didn’t want to, could play the game better and would most likely rule from his trusted circle and wouldn’t have such a risk of manipulation. They’re both ferocious and dangerous fighters, terrifyingly dedicated to their people but I’m not sure either of them would’ve made an amazing king. They both have a very similar flaw in how their honor and desires conflict and because of that I cannot really choose one over the other.

TLDR: I say a lot of things but can’t pick a side 😂 Ideally I think Renly and Loras should’ve been kings. Westeros wasn’t ready for gay excellence but I am.
